basics.name: Yee Man Ng
basics.summary:
A highly driven and proactive NLP researcher at Leiden University (LIACS), with a Research Master in Human Language Technology (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam). Conducted research at the intersection of AI and language in an interdisciplinary setting. 
    Passionate about exploring the use of NLP to deal with complex societal issues.

work.company: Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science (Leiden University)
work.summary:
NLP Researcher in the Translational Data Science Lab, working on implementing generative AI in a daily diary app for cancer patients and survivors
     to achieve better insights out of their data, ultimately helping people better understand how their daily activities might affect their recovery.

education.institution: Computational Linguistics & Text Mining Lab, VU Amsterdam
education.area: Research MA in Human Language Technology (Natural Language Processing)
courses: Thesis: A Comparative Study of Open-Source and Closed-Source Large Language Models for Native Language Identification

education.area: MA in English Education and Communication (Teaching Program)
education.summary: Trained to become an English teacher, following courses on education, pedagogy, and English second language acquisition

education.area: BA in English Language and Culture (English Linguistics)
courses: Thesis: The World of Keyboard Virologists: Language Use of Reddit Users in COVID-19 Vaccine News Discussions

publications.name:
Leveraging Open-Source Large Language Models for Native Lan-
guage Identification
publications.publisher:
The Twelfth Workshop on NLP for Similar Languages, Varieties, and Di-
alects (VarDial), co-located with COLING 2025
publications.summary: Comparing and fine-tuning open-source large language models (LLMs) for the task of Native Language Identification, the task of identifying the native language (L1) of a person based on their writing in the second language (L2).

presentations.name: Conceptual Changes in HIV and AIDS: Distributional Semantics Meets History
presentations.authors: Ng, Y. M., Grantsaan, D., Läuferts, J., Rozema, C., & Sommerauer, P.
presentations.description: Using distributional semantic models to study conceptual changes in the HIV and AIDS discourse, showing how the meaning of words related to HIV and AIDS has changed over time.

grants.name: VU Amsterdam Graduate School of Humanities Research Grant
grants.description: Funding for the project 'Conceptual Changes in HIV and AIDS: Distributional Semantics Meets History', a collaboration between Leiden University and the University of Amsterdam.

volunteer.summary:
Asian Raisins is an organization fighting racism towards (South-)East Asian people in the Netherlands. The
Storytelling program shares personal stories from the community, giving this under-represented group a voice. Responsible for supervising the Storytelling team and projects.
